header.title: MEZLIM, Volume I, Issue No. 2
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Magic, Thelema, Chaos Magic, Astrology

central_thesis: This journal issue serves as a forum for exploring the evolving landscape of Western Esotericism and Occultism at the threshold of a 'New Aeon.' It emphasizes practical magical methodologies from diverse traditions, including updated Thelemic-Golden Dawn rituals, operative Chaos Magic principles, and advanced sex magickian crystal work, all while fostering individual sovereignty and critical engagement with traditional and emerging magical paradigms.

structure_content.summary: Kenneth Deigh reflects on Beltane/Walpurgis Nacht as a period of profound transition and rebirth, highlighting humanity's integral role in cosmic magick. He notes the disconnection from ancient rites in modern life and calls for a discovery of 'something we can only know by becoming.'

Authored by Sam Webster, this ritual aims to establish energetic and mythic structures of the Sovereign Sanctuary of the Gnosis, specifically empowering the 'Pastos of the Vault of the Adepti.' It involves precise vocalic vibrations (Do What Thou Wilt, A.B.R.A., Had!, N.O.X., Aum. Ha.) and corresponding physical signs (One Star in Sight, Serpent Twined, Giving Birth, End of Work) to form and anchor a 'tetrahedron' or 'stabilized cube' around the magus.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Rite of the Secret Doors
structure_content.summary: Tamo Willsat's rite focuses on invoking solar force/energy/consciousness and encoding the mythic structure of the Book of the Law. It begins with 'Raising the Spell of Ra-Hoor-Khuit,' followed by setting elemental quarters (East-Air, South-Fire, West-Water, North-Earth) using Solar Hexagrams and vibrating 'ARARITA.' Adorations to various aspects of Ra (Ra, Ahathoor, Atum, Keph-Ra, Ra-Hoor-Khuit) are accompanied by the Sign of the Enterer, other signs, and concludes with vibrating 'HERU-RA-HA,' symbolizing the manifestation of unified solar force.

Kenneth Deigh presents a ritual blessing for the soles of the feet, palms of the hands, and crown of the head, designed for initiates embarking on journeys to the 'planes of Silver and Gold.' It involves anointing with specific oils (citron, Myrrh, Dragon's Blood, Olibanum, Ambergris) and scents (cedar, musk, war, Eucalyptus, Camphor), each point accompanied by blessings that connect the initiate to the journey, awakening, and their 'solar nature' as Deity. The final vibration 'EHYA!' resonates with 'I AM THAT I AM.'

structure_content.chapter_title: An Invitation to the Thelemic Order of the Golden Dawn
structure_content.summary: Sam Webster outlines a new Thelemic Order of the Golden Dawn, operating as a non-hierarchical network without secrecy or gender bias. It aims to make initiatic technology accessible and foster 'Personal Sovereignty.' Membership is voluntary, and the validity of initiations is contingent on the aspirant's 'worthiness/readiness' rather than external authority or perfect ritual performance.

Peter J. Carroll critically examines traditional magic and advocates for Chaos Magic, a paradigm focused on fundamental techniques for altering subconscious beliefs, independent of dogmatic belief systems. He emphasizes practical results and views Chaos Magic as a defense against 'madness' by embracing that 'nothing is true and everything is permitted.' The Magical Pact of the Illuminates of Thanateros (IOT) is presented as a coherent expression of this tradition.

Antero Alli provides an astrological analysis of the 1991-1995 Uranus/Neptune conjunction, interpreting it as a 'Collective Shock Wave' of transpersonal forces leading to global shifts. He predicts the dissolution of Communism, Christianity, and Capitalism, alongside the rise of Organized Crime, Artistic Renaissance, and Global Ecology. Uranus is linked to 'True Will' and entity autonomy, while Neptune signifies 'unbounded dissolution' and a return to spiritual origins.

Donald Michael Kraig recounts historical disputes between occult groups (e.g., AMORC vs. Brotherhood of the Rosy Cross) over claims of authenticity and lineage. He critiques these 'wars' as relics of a past aeon, arguing that the 'validity and workability' of magical information and techniques are more important than historical tracing or organizational claims in the current age.

Lairus challenges conventional notions of compassion, using personal anecdotes and societal examples (Welfare system) to question actions driven by pity rather than True Will. He introduces 'The Economics of Abundance' as a future paradigm, advocating for decisions rooted in understanding one's Will rather than emotional impulses.

structure_content.chapter_title: A Sex Magickian's Alchemical Guide to Quartz Crystals Pt II
structure_content.summary: Bill Siebert offers a detailed, practical guide for using quartz crystals in advanced magical work. Techniques include mirror meditation, dream work (sleeping with crystals, recording, and altering dreams), and the use of 'orgasmic crystal water' charged with sexual fluids for 'phantasy actualization.' It also covers creating 'crystal waters' with solar or elemental charges, and methods for 'editing' (cleansing with salt water) and 'fixing' (programming via fire ritual) crystals to store specific information or energies.

A comic strip by Rick McCollum and Ken Day, featuring Lovecraftian themes ('That is not dead which can eternal lie') and Crowleyan quotes, depicting a confrontation between a New Age radio show host promoting Wicca/Goddess worship and a Cthulhu Mythos devotee, illustrating the 'changing of the Cosmic Guard' and the 'Equinox of the Gods.'

Laurali's article explores personal relationships and self-discovery through the lens of Yechida (universal Life/Love force). The author reflects on past ideals of 'saviors' (chivalrous knights) and inner psychological struggles, concluding that 'there is no savior, except my own courage,' and that internal autonomy is key to resolving personal conflicts.

key_concepts.definition: A period of significant transition and paradigm shift in magic, society, and consciousness, moving beyond old structures like secrecy and hierarchy, as presented across multiple articles within the journal.

The philosophical and magical framework, particularly 'Do What Thou Wilt,' underpinning the updated Golden Dawn practices and various rituals described, focusing on the discovery and expression of True Will.

A key Thelemic deity, an aspect of Horus, whose energetic and mythic structure is invoked and integrated into rituals like 'The Spell of Ra-Hoor-Khuit' and 'The Rite of the Secret Doors,' representing force and fire.
A Gnostic-Qabalistic word of power, used in the Rite of the Secret Doors to create unity among hexagrams and to reduce sixfold energies into a singular point, crucial for solar manifestation.

Specific physical postures and gestures used in rituals (e.g., One Star in Sight, Serpent Twined, Giving Birth, End of Work, Enterer, Silence, Triumph) to evoke particular magical forces, states of consciousness, or aspects of divinity.

A core tenet of the Thelemic Order of the Golden Dawn, defined as the self-awareness of personal responsibility for one's actions and consequences, embodying individual autonomy and freedom without exerting 'power-over' others.

A magical paradigm that prioritizes mastering fundamental techniques for changing subconscious beliefs over adherence to rigid dogmas or lineages. It embraces the principle that 'nothing is true and everything is permitted' and uses laughter as a psychological defense against the 'madness' of perceived reality.

In Antero Alli's astrological context, associated with Uranus, it is the innate intention of an entity (individual, society, or natural phenomenon), articulating its 'entity autonomy' and inherent capacity for complete self-expression.

In Antero Alli's astrological context, associated with Neptune, it is a pervasive force that dissolves ego-based structures and returns elements to their 'prima materia,' leading to spiritualization and a communion with nature, often requiring surrender.

A proposed 21st-century economic paradigm by Lairus, contrasting with the 'Economics of Scarcity,' where technological advancements (robotics, computerization) ensure that basic needs are met for all, requiring redistribution of abundance rather than traditional labor.

The operative use of quartz crystals as tools for meditation, dream manipulation, energy work, and alchemical processes. This includes charging them with specific vibrations, using them for sexual fluid-based spellcraft, and processes of 'editing' (cleansing) and 'fixing' (programming) their inherent nature.

Water charged with sexual fluids and magical intent during sex magick, used to 'seed' dreams, 'reify phantasies' into waking reality, and transfer energy within a magical working. It is a potent tool for subconscious programming and manifestation.

practical_system.description: The journal presents a composite practical system drawing from Thelemic Golden Dawn methods, Chaos Magic, and specialized crystal work. It focuses on personal transformation, attunement to divine forces (especially Ra-Hoor-Khuit), and the manipulation of subconscious beliefs and dream states to effect change in both inner and outer realities. The system emphasizes direct experience, individual sovereignty, and the pragmatic application of magical techniques rather than rigid adherence to external dogma or lineage.
tools: Vocalizations (vibrations of words of power: A.B.R.A., ARARITA, HERU-RA-HA, EHYA!, etc.)
Oils (citron, Myrrh, Dragon's Blood, Olibanum, Ambergris)
Quartz crystals (various types, used as 'dream crystals,' 'charging crystals,' 'gateway crystals')
Candle (as a focal point for meditation and ritual fire)
Sexual fluids/orgasms (as a powerful energy source in sex magick)
Metallic salts (iron, gold, copper, zinc, mercury, used to 'flavor' crystals for specific magical intentions)
Fire (as a medium for crystal 'fixing' rituals)
Magical notebook/journal (for recording meditations, dreams, and magical workings)
rituals: The Spell of Ra-Hoor-Khuit (Thelemic vibration and sign work for energetic structuring)
The Rite of the Secret Doors (Invoking solar forces, setting elemental quarters with hexagrams and specific adorations)
The Five Point Blessing (Anointing ritual for initiatory journeys, activating specific body points with oils, scents, and blessings)
Crystal Meditation Exercise (Mirror meditation with crystal for self-reflection and apparition work)
Preliminary Dream Work with Crystals (Using crystals during sleep to enhance dream recall and influence dream states)
Intermediate Dream Techniques (Utilizing orgasms and 'orgasmic crystal water' with crystals for dream/phantasy actualization and reification)
Crystal Cleansing (Dilute salt water bath for removing transient information from crystals)
Crystal Fixing (Fire ritual for making crystal programming permanent or transferring information to 'Gaia's archives')

relevant_quotes.text: Fiat Lux Voluntas! (Let there be light!)
The rituals shall be half known and half concealed.
Blessed be the journey of this Child of the Dove. Beloved spark of the sun after the fall of light.
From these ashes come forth Stars.
the aspirant's worthiness/readiness is the deciding factor in whether or not the initiation 'takes.'
nothing is true and everything is permitted.
Uranus pushes us to BE OUR TRUE SELVES; anything that gets in the way meets with unpredictable disruption and disarray.
"THAT IS NOT DEAD WHICH CAN ETERNAL LIE, AND WITH STRANGE EONS, EVEN DEATH MAY DIE."

critical_analysis.relevance: MEZLIM Volume I, Issue No. 2, published in 1990, offers a pertinent snapshot of Western Esotericism at a pivotal moment. It navigates the tension between traditional Golden Dawn/Thelemic structures and the emergent, iconoclastic principles of Chaos Magic. The inclusion of detailed ritual instructions alongside theoretical discussions makes it a valuable resource for operative magicians. The journal's emphasis on 'personal sovereignty' and the re-evaluation of lineage reflects a broader shift in occult thought towards individual practice and efficacy over institutional authority. The astrological commentary on the Uranus/Neptune conjunction grounds the magical work within contemporary societal and planetary shifts, underscoring its relevance to practitioners seeking to engage with current world dynamics through a magical lens.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is primarily working magi, serious practitioners, and academic researchers in Western Esotericism and Occultism. This includes adherents of Thelema, Golden Dawn traditions, Qabalah, and those interested in Chaos Magic. The detailed ritual instructions cater to practitioners seeking operative guidance, while the theoretical articles appeal to those interested in the philosophy, history, and social relevance of magic. Specific sections, like 'A Sex Magickian's Alchemical Guide to Quartz Crystals,' target advanced practitioners exploring specialized branches of magical work. The critique of 'The War of the Roses' and the discussion 'On Cruelty' also resonate with an audience concerned with ethical and communal aspects of the occult world.
